pullRequest.title: SOLR-14223 PublicKeyHandler consumes a lot of entropy during tests
pullRequest.bodyText: Use a non-blocking implementation of SecureRandom for generating RSA Keys.

nodes.bodyText: This must not be static or shared across test instances. A better solution would be to create this off an initial long seed and this seed should be taken from RandomizedContext.current..().random().nextLong().
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@

+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+package org.apache.solr.util;
+
+import java.security.SecureRandom;
+import java.security.SecureRandomSpi;
+import java.util.Random;
+
+/**
+ * A mocked up instance of SecureRandom that just uses {@link Random} under the covers.
+ * This is to prevent blocking issues that arise in platform default
+ * SecureRandom instances due to too many instances / not enough random entropy.
+ * Tests do not need secure SSL.
+ */
+public class NotSecurePsuedoRandom extends SecureRandom {
+  public static final SecureRandom INSTANCE = new NotSecurePsuedoRandom();
+  private static final Random RAND = new Random(42);

beforeCommit.message: SOLR-14223 PublicKeyHandler consumes a lot of entropy during tests

commit.message:
SOLR-14223 Create RSAKeyPair from disk

* Create properties for PublicKeyHandler to read existing keys from disk
* Move pregenerated keys from core/test-files to test-framework
* Update tests to use existing keys instead of new keys each run

afterCommit.message:
SOLR-14223 Create RSAKeyPair from disk

* Create properties for PublicKeyHandler to read existing keys from disk
* Move pregenerated keys from core/test-files to test-framework
